text:
Hi, everyone!
I have a question about the word embedding layer.
What is the standard way to deal with the words out of vocabulary when using the embedding layer? Are all words out of vocabulary mapping all-zero vector? Or there is a special key in the vocabulary to record these unknown words?

Hi, everyone!
I have a question about the word embedding layer.
What is the standard way to deal with the words out of vocabulary when using the embedding layer? Are all words out of vocabulary mapping all-zero vector? Or there is a special key in the vocabulary to record these unknown words?

text:
The pytorch implementation of embeddings is as follows.
Specify the padding idx during init.
That idx within the embedding layer is all zeros.

Knowing this, youd have to set all unknown words to have the idx of the padding idx, prior to model input/fitting

Hope this helps.
